Review.Titre: new rules even for paid customers
Review.Contenu: I've been a lifetime subscriber to StrongVPN, but my smooth ride hit a bump two days ago. I suddenly couldn't connect to any of their servers.I reached out to their support team, hoping for a fix. But when I mentioned where I was located, they dropped a bombshell – they don't serve my region anymore. This was a shocker, considering I have a paid, active subscription.It's frustrating and just plain wrong. If you're a paying customer, you expect them to support you.Update:I decided to give them another shot after they responded to my review. Unfortunately, they stuck to their guns, saying there were no refunds or solutions. They're based in the United States, so you'd think they'd play by the rules.It's a bummer that they decided to cut me off from the service I paid for, with no chance of a refund. This situation makes you wonder how they'd react if government requests your data!

Review.Titre: One time purchase means one time each month!
Review.Contenu: I purchased a "one time" activation of StrongVPN services, and they took money from my PayPal again the following month.  One their website they offered a "monthly" service for about $5 a month, or a "one time" for one month for about $10.  I chose the "one time".  I was looking for a VPN service to use temporarily, and "How To Geek" recommended them.  I won't be trusting them anymore either.  Once purchased, I received an email with user and password info.  Following instructions was not clear.  I had to download an app to connect.  Windows wouldn't allow the download.  I contacted StrongVPN for my money back, and they said use a different browser.  I finally got the app to download, and signed on.  Google was displayed in Arabic fonts with a link to English.  I had to wait several times while the service buffered while using it.  And after all that, they charged me again!  RUN...  Stay away!

However, the new server which is based in the Netherlands is terrible and a once great service is now a nightmare. The service constantly drops out, is slow and stops working without warning. Forget watching a film or listening to a radio without interruption as virtually every few minutes there is a problem. I've already complained to Strong VPN customer service but nothing has changed and be very wary signing up to them based upon reliability of service as this is now very unreliable! It's a shame as Strong VPN used to be so good but if it continues I will leave and find another VPN as the service is becoming almost impossible to use without constant interruptions!

Review.Titre: Be warned! They will use an expired credit card!
Review.Contenu: I had this service in China back in 2016 and it frequently wouldn't work, always being blocked, so when it came up for renewal in 2017 as I was leaving China decided to cancel. They sent me a notice saying I needed to enter new payment details for my service to continue, but instead I responded saying no thanks, I would like to cancel. Fast forward to 2021 and I get another renewal notice. So, thinking it was strange, I investigated.Turns out that the email I received and responded to was a no-reply email, there was nothing in the email to tell you that unless you checked for it hidden away in the email address, plus there was no automated response to tell you that you had emailed an unmonitored address! It was all set up to catch out the unwary. There was also no link to cancel, just a "give us new credit card details here". Couldn't have gone to their site at the time anyhow as their web address was blocked!Turns out that they continued the service and continued taking money despite it being an expired credit card, despite the service never being used, and kept on taking it even though the service was clearly unused.Yes I know I should have seen it on my credit card but I didn't. But, also, I have up until 2021 never received any renewal notice and have never received a payment invoice, otherwise I would have known earlier.I have never used the service, I switched to ExpressVPN and can prove I had that MUCH SUPERIOR service during that time.Contacting them, they initially didn't want to know, but eventually returned the one payment from 2020, but refused to return the other 3 payments saying it was against their T&C to refund such old payments.I will be contacting the bank, but am sure they also will say it is too old but would be interesting to hear how they can use expired credit card details. They have found a loophole in the system to keep taking money from people, just a scam.

Review.Titre: Sorry to disagree
Review.Contenu: I got Strong VPN because of the many positive reviews I saw here and other places.  I signed up for a year-long subscription, downloaded everything, and got started.   Upon connecting to Strong VPN my computer started popping up the "Internet Connections" window and then the "LAN Settings" window and then closing them over and over.  It made my system (Microsoft Surface Pro 2) inoperable. So I used their customer service.  I was about 2 minutes with the first person who said they would get a tech person, and then waited 15 minutes for the tech person, who had me install support software so that he could operate my computer remotely.  After about 45 more minutes he didn't have it working...  "It's not working" he said lamely.  So we gave up. I expected that they would open a service ticket and get back to me, but not hearing anything for 2 days, I emailed them with my problem, asking for a fix or my money back.  5 days later, conveniently outside of their 7 day "money back guarantee" window, I get an email with my problem listed as medium priority and couple questions like where I am (which you tell them when you sign up for the service) and how I connect. So...  I'm getting no love from Strong VPN.  Take your chances.  Looks like a lot of people are getting good service and find it a good product, however, I  might add, that it is a psychological fact that when it appears that a vast majority of people have a particular belief, those who don't agree tend to keep quiet about their views.  This is even true with online reviews.  So take your guess: am I just really unlucky? or did I just get ripped off?  Since StrongVPN hasn't solved my problem, or given me my money back right now I'm thinking option 2.

Review.Contenu: The service is great and i love it and ive been on it since over 7 years now when it was still IBVPN before the merging.however, it feels like your services run some sort of FUP (Fair usage policies) where if we stress it or use a pre-defined amount of data on it, it becomes slow, very slow.I myself am a penetration tester, i work with cyber security firms, everytime i need to test a client for DOS (Denial Of Service) TCP floods, the VPN turns SUPER slow until i disconnect and reconnect to another server. i dont know why a great company like StrongVPN requires FUP, but if that was the case, please fix it. if FUP was not the problem, but some other random tech causing the issue, also please fix it.Great service overall.thank you and have a great day.PS: i set a date of experience only because it was mandatory in order to send the review. however, the issue has always been there since IBVPN became StrongVPN.

Depending of the server I choose with your program, the download speed goes down up to 50% of the one I get frrom my local server. Other problem I have is that when I don´t need to use sStrong VPN, I have to restart my computer. Review.Contenu: I have been impressed with Strong VPN for 10 years, but have been disappointed this year. Primarily we use the VPN to use the BBC I-player in Turkey. The BBC has blocked users of the VPN on numerous occasions but the 'fix' does not allow users of Windows NT to access the BBC. When I am out of the country my wife uses an old computer and cannot access the BBC.

Review.Titre: What I like, and what I don't like about StrongVPN
Review.Contenu: What I like about StrongVPN:* no noticeable increase in latency* no noticeable reduction of speedWhat I don't like in StrongVPN:* it tends to disconnect when I leave my pc/laptop alone for a while* on my Android phone, it only re-directs my browser traffic, not other (such as tethering (this is serious; I don't know if - for example - whatsapp, google maps and skype traffic goes through StrongVPN on my Android phone)

Review.Titre: It was not as FAST as I expected!

Review.Contenu: So... they're fine. I've used them for a couple years now. HOWEVER, there are some things that just don't work sometimes: 1) A sudden drop that will break my feed, or 2) A server issue that brings a connection fail and a dialogue box, or 3) It won't work with video feed for one of the main UK-based sites I am trying to watch. Overall, when it works, it works fine, but there are a handful of ways listed above that I'd like to see better addressed. Thanks.

Review.Titre: When it works, it's great!
Review.Contenu: When it works, it's great.  The variety of potential cities is quite nice, and the connection is typically quite fast, enough for streaming, etc.However, on some days, the connection drops constantly, it'll be up for 5 minutes, then lose connection, reconnect, and then lose connection again.  This on/off process really brings down the average speed.This complaint aside, we haven't yet found a better service at this price, so we've stuck with them for the past 6 years.

Review.Contenu: As for the product, I rate it at 4 stars, Service 2 stars as the  communication is not very good. Review.Titre: I cannot access ITV from your VPN…
Review.Contenu: I cannot access ITV from your VPN servers in UK!  You were working on this six months ago but still no progress.The work around you suggested - which was to use the DNS service - is not viable, since the carriers apply bandwidth restrictions (throttling) which stops the streaming.  The result is that the user has to pause the stream, ESC the full screen, reload the page, and then select the restart option from ITV.  This may be okay for one occurrence and hour, but some carriers do repeated stops every few minutes which destroys the value of streaming a TV show.  This is ongoing and I suspect a permanent problem - new users beware!

Review.Titre: Cumbersome to log in
Review.Contenu: Cumbersome to log in. Not user friendly. Changing passwords is not easy.  Often times takes a long time to find a server and log on. Price of $ 55 a year is too high. Other VPNs with higher quality online service offer $ 36 a year.

Review.Titre: No Renewal Reminders
Review.Contenu: I have a problem with them not sending renewal reminders.  I noticed a charge on my statement and when I checked my email I saw NO reminder email about the upcoming charge. If I'd known/remembered, I would have canceled. Given the environment we are in, I do not need a VPN right now.  If I'd remembered about the renewal, I would have canceled before the charge. I did like their service when I got to use it, but not sending email reminders about renewals is unethical.  Best practice should be to send reminders about upcoming renewals for ALL subscription services.  We are in subscription hell these days. It's impossible to keep up with all of them...  Do better.

Review.Titre: Strongly recommended (with minor caveats)
Review.Contenu: I have been a satisfied and persistent customer for years. I do recommend the service despite some nuisances noted below, which should explain why I rated 4 instead of 5. But first, the positives:+ Virtually no speed drop. You hardly feel you're using a VPN bridge+ Wide range of servers to pick from around the world, although that bit is open to improvement (no servers in Japan, for instance).+ Stable, seamless, efficient connection. With the help of the client automatizing the switch, you don't have to worry about micromanaging your connection settings. Even if the client fails, your native connection is simply restored without a hassle.+ Good customer service and long-time customer benefits.And now why I give 4/5 instead of full honors:- Occasional, admittedly infrequent downtime. It doesn't happen too often but when it happens, it happens.- Recent price rise. The US thinks it has an inflation problem. Those of us who have become used to living under constant hyperinflation and devaluation policies are laughing. Sorry for not being able to empathize.- Clunky interface. You can only turn off the client from the system tray (which is a downgrade from earlier versions a few years ago) and sometimes, if thankfully not very often, it silently crashes.

Review.Titre: I love the multiple country options as…
Review.Contenu: I love the multiple country options as well as the multiple device sign in. Then in, it is fast and a steady connection when it is successfully running. The only downside is that, from time-to-time, it fails to assign an IP address. This can be frustrating in a pinch. To solve it, I sometimes end up restarting the application several times or, when that doesn't work, I restart my laptop.

Review.Titre: The customer service is excellent
Review.Contenu: The customer service is excellent - very efficient and responsive. The only frustrating part is sometimes not being able to access various channels and a note that comes up saying "your internet details have changed" (or something like that). What seems to happen is I leave it and go back the next day and it is fine but can be frustrating. I've tried changing browsers but that doesn't seem to help. Fortunately it isn't very often but still annoying!

Review.Titre: Best VPN I've tried (and I've tried at…

It is necessary to exit the program, then send, then restart the VPN. This is true of all the VPN services I've tried. (Receiving emails is not affected by StrongVPN). StrongVPN is fast to access, and does not seem to impact computer speed negatively. It is easy to use the settings.

Pressing connect does nothing. It's worth mentioning that all other protocols work consistently.

Review.Titre: Strong VPN great on mobile, less so on the desktop.

On my desktop, Strong VNP sometimes disconnects. I make a habit of monitoring it. Sometimes remote site access is blocked because of security settings in either Strong VPN or the customer's access protocol. Also, if I am on Strong VPN, and use a customer VPN before I RDP, I have to disconnect from Strong. This is not a complaint, only an observation.

Review.Titre: I've been a StrongVPN user for about 6…

Review.Titre: I surf behind the Great Firewall
Review.Contenu: I surf behind the Great Firewall.  StrongVPN has been a lifesaver for me. The service has been very responsive to my help requests when the Great Firewall has succeeded in blocking ports and interrupting services, by providing more robust configurations, currently OPEN VPN FTP protocol.  It's a challenge to connect at times, and often requires a reboot to clear caches before a connection is possible, but once connected on OSX Mojave, the service is locked in.  IOS IKEv2 protocol is more variable, slow to connect, and generally only good for 1-2 minutes before disconnecting.  I use StrongVPN interchangeably with a SSL (socks) proxy server giving me the security of always being able to contact StrongVPN through the Socks host and vice versa for service.  I am satisfied with the StrongVPN service except for the IOS version, and a customer continuously for ~6 years.

The old version of the app is a little old school, if you use it with an Android TV, you will need a mouse to navigate, while the new version used to work ok with the remote controller buttons.4. If you connect the VPN from China, the Chinese websites/apps will not work well, and if you don't connect the VPN the other international websites/app will not work well. So you have to switch on and off manually all the time.
